subject: Education
title: The Printing Press and the Democratization of Knowledge
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Printing Press and the Democratization of Knowledge.

hook.text: Before Gutenberg, a single book cost more than a house.

buildup.text: Hand-copying meant books were rare, expensive, and controlled by the Church.

discovery.text: The printing press made books cheap enough for merchants, then eventually for everyone.

twist.text: Authorities panickedâ€”widespread reading meant people could form their own opinions.

climax.text: Literacy rates exploded, and with them, the demand for schools multiplied.

punchline.text: One machine turned knowledge from a privilege into a right.

quiz.question: How did the printing press change education?
options: It made books affordable, driving literacy and demand for schools
It was only used to print religious texts
